title: Lookouts
body: According to Dr. Azevedo, they were 'military and fiscal stations that watched the sea, coasts, and beaches in order to sound the alarm for corsairs or any other enemy ships, and to prevent smuggling. The lookouts were manned by the people, in small strong houses, purposefully built to withstand the sea and prevent surprises. In 1567, D. Sebasti達o regulated them, a regulation that is recorded in volume V, page 105, of the Archive of the Funchal City Council, and, by royal decree of 1569, he determined that no one would be exempt from this service.'

Funchal: Location of the Archive of the Funchal City Council

1567: Regulation given by D. Sebasti達o to the lookouts
1569: Royal decree of D. Sebasti達o regarding the service of the lookouts
